review_title: Great place to work, but not enough fulltime  positions
job_title: Lab Technician in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Great people. Flexibility. Decent PTO. Being able to work with students.
cons: The college district relies on part time staff and part time faculty/professors to make up the bulk of their workforce. This allows them to not pay benefits. Non professor staff could be working 4-5 days a week, but hours will be capped at 30 hours so they cannot get benefits. This is a pay equity issue. It is very difficult to secure full time, and this district does not provide health insurance for their part time employees like some other college districts do.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Great full-time faculty, great part-time faculty, stockroom staff is top-notch
cons: Nothing really, it's a great place to work

job_title: Tutor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: The management was incredibly supportive and friendly.
cons: There was not a lot of opportunity for increased pay at the time, but I was there a few years ago.

review_title: Great working environment. Highly recommend any job from this college.
job_title: Research Assistant in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Positive working experience. Communication skills research abilities will help you to be more successful.
cons: None.  Working environment is positive and Professors are extremely helpful and great to work with.

job_title: Project Specialist in Mission Viejo, CA

job_title: Professor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Ranked 12th out of 114 community colleges in California, and recognized in the U.S. as one of the best community colleges in the country. Ample training for FT and PT faculty. Opportunities to participate in committees and shared governance for FT and PT faculty.
cons: FT to PT faculty ratio is not adequate and needs to be more level. The workload expectations increase yearly. The area is extremely expensive, so the "high pay" doesn't translate to much in an area where the "low-income threshold" is $90,000 for a family of 4. For PT faculty, it's impossible to live in the area for the wages given, but abysmal PT faculty pay is endemic in academia.

job_title: Math Tutor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Friendly, Relaxed, Funny, Easy, Enjoyable, Happy
cons: There's not much to say other than the pay could be a little higher, but you get paid by the hour so if you don't help anyone during your shift, you still get paid.

job_title: Professor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Great pay and amazing benefits for FT faculty. But the area (housing, specifically) is so expensive the pay barely covers living expenses.
cons: Some in management are overly focused on minutiae, others are bossy, some are micro-managers. But some are great. And all want the mission to succeed. So, it’s just like any other workplace, I suppose.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Orange, CA
pros: Great place to work. Love it.
cons: None but the pay scale

job_title: Math Tutor in Irvine, CA
pros: The tutoring center is a great place to work. A lot of young and fun people who are very hard working and optimistic.
cons: It gets too crowded sometimes but overall is a great work place.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Interesting projects for great clients in Fine Arts, Counseling, etc. Most campus clients treat you well with respect and appreciation for your help. Great benefits if your supervisor allows you to use them without giving you a hard time (vacation, sick days). Hours are 8am to 5pm with next to no overtime.
cons: This is not a "sour grapes" review by a dissatisfied former employee... I merely want to warn others who might get taken in like myself and many before me. As I have come to realize, Graphics & Publications has a history of engaging in shady practices by hiring people on a one-year "probation" status and then not extending them so they won't be able to join the union and protect themselves from poor treatment. Employees with tenure get away with poor performance, coming in late, lots of personal dramas & time out of the office, etc. while probationary employees can't even take sick days for valid illness without being verbally abused & openly accused of trying to avoid work and being irresponsible. An underlying mean-spirited attitude by senior employees towards campus clients as well as towards new employees. You will be expected to perform perfectly on the most difficult projects even though you are hired at the lowest rung on the ladder. I have worked in the design field for over 20 years and this is the most unprofessional situation I've ever been in.

job_title: Counselor in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Supportive Community where coworkers work together
cons: No job stability. Hours vary every semester.

review_title: Lack of respect for Temp employees
job_title: in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: They have good working hours.  That is it if you work as a temp
cons: I worked as a substitute program assistant and interviewed for the permanent position.  I received no courtesy phone call or e-mail letting me know that I did not get the job.  I did not know until the day after my last day after calling HR and leaving several messages.  I was basically told don't come back on Monday we don't need you anymore.   I was extremely appalled by this treatment.

review_title: Large gap between upper level and lower level employees
job_title: Project Specialist in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Nice people, beautiful campus, great location. I loved the impact my project had on the people who it was for. There were great social events as well, lunches and get togethers that allowed me to interact with other employees.
cons: Not really much room for advancement, hard to get ideas heard or approved. Also being a temporary employee, the union extremely limited the status of my employment (ie if you are not a permanent employee, you cannot work a full work week and are only allowed to work a certain number of days and hours per year).

job_title: NBU in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: You have interaction with students of all ages, faculty, professors, and lifetime learners.  I am an NBU but I understand that if a permanent employee, the health insurance is fantastic.
cons: As a large school, there is lots of bureaucracy. It can be difficult to move up. They seem to hire more and more staff without ensuring there is room, and there is staff literally working in closets-turned-semi offices.

review_title: Nice environment, if you can handle the red tape
job_title: in Mission Viejo, CA
pros: Benefits are excellent, permanent employees are afforded job security
cons: Management is out of touch with staff and students, bureaucracy is unwieldy, shared governance groups on campus make change nearly impossible and spend most of their time battling for power. People are undervalued and performance is rarely recognized--lazy folks get away with not doing much work.

job_title: Senior Lab Tech in Mission Viejo, CA
pros:
Your gaining experience while attending school.
Your helping others while improving your skills (When your able to explain and help others it really means you know your stuff).
You get access to Schools First FCU, awesome bank.
Looks amazing on Resumes/CV, always a good conversation starter in Interviews, perfect for SAR questions.
cons: Had to work for free until i became a senior tech to make some money and very little at that.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mission Viejo, CA

cons: I was surprised at the amount of bureaucracy a school could generate. Sometime this is very encumbering. Salaries are particularly low compared to similar work at almost any other venue.

review_title: An okay place to work, not a lifelong career company
